title: Requires the department of health to monitor the lead levels in candy, soft vinyl lunch boxes and bibs
summary: Requires the department of health to monitor the lead levels in candy and to prohibit the sale or distribution of candy with lead in it; prohibits the manufacture, distribution, sale and offering for sale of soft vinyl lunch boxes and infant and children's bibs containing more than 600 parts per million of lead; imposes a $1,000 fine for each violation relating to soft vinyl lunch boxes and infant and children's bibs; directs the department of health to conduct an extensive public information program on lead in candy, soft vinyl lunch boxes and infant and children's bibs.

       AN ACT to amend the public health law, in relation  to  lead  in  candy,
         soft vinyl lunch boxes, and infant and children's vinyl bibs

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. The public health law is amended by adding two new sections
    2  1371-a and 1371-b to read as follows:
    3    S 1371-A. LEAD IN CANDY. 1. THE DEPARTMENT SHALL MONITOR  LEAD  LEVELS
    4  IN  ALL CANDY SOLD OR DISTRIBUTED IN THE STATE. MONITORING SHALL INCLUDE
    5  SAMPLING AND TESTING TO DETERMINE  THE  LEAD  LEVELS  CONTAINED  IN  THE
    6  CANDY.
    7    2.  FOR  THE  PURPOSES OF THIS SECTION, "MAXIMUM ALLOWABLE LEAD LEVEL"
    8  SHALL MEAN ONE-TENTH PART OF LEAD PER MILLION PARTS  AS  ESTABLISHED  IN
    9  THE  REGULATIONS  AND  GUIDELINES  OF THE FEDERAL FOOD AND DRUG ADMINIS-
   10  TRATION.
   11    3. IF THE LEAD LEVEL IN CANDY THAT IS TESTED BY THE DEPARTMENT  PURSU-
   12  ANT  TO  SUBDIVISION  ONE  OF THIS SECTION EXCEEDS THE MAXIMUM ALLOWABLE
   13  LEAD LEVEL, THE DEPARTMENT SHALL:
   14    (A) ISSUE HEALTH ADVISORY NOTICES TO COUNTY HEALTH DEPARTMENTS  ALERT-
   15  ING  THEM TO THE DANGER POSED BY CONSUMPTION OF SUCH CANDY EXCEEDING THE
   16  MAXIMUM ALLOWABLE LEAD LEVEL; AND
   17    (B) NOTIFY THE MANUFACTURER AND THE DISTRIBUTOR  OF  SUCH  CANDY  THAT
   18  SUCH CANDY EXCEEDS THE MAXIMUM ALLOWABLE LEAD LEVEL, AND THAT SUCH CANDY
   19  SHALL  NOT  BE  SOLD  OR  DISTRIBUTED IN THE STATE UNTIL FURTHER TESTING
   20  PROVES THAT THE CANDY IS IN COMPLIANCE WITH THE MAXIMUM  ALLOWABLE  LEAD
   21  LEVEL.
   22    4. (A) IF CANDY EXCEEDS THE MAXIMUM ALLOWABLE LEAD LEVEL, THE MANUFAC-
   23  TURER  OR  DISTRIBUTOR  THEREOF MAY CORRECT THE PROBLEM AND RESUBMIT THE
   24  CANDY TO THE DEPARTMENT FOR FURTHER TESTING.
   25    (B) IF THE LEAD CONTENT OF SUCH CANDY IS BELOW THE  MAXIMUM  ALLOWABLE
   26  LEAD  LEVEL  WHEN  IT  IS  RETESTED,  THE  DEPARTMENT  SHALL PROVIDE THE
   27  MANUFACTURER OR DISTRIBUTOR AND THE  COUNTY  HEALTH  DEPARTMENT  WITH  A
   28  LETTER  STATING  THAT  THE  CANDY  HAS  BEEN  RETESTED AND DETERMINED TO

    2  AND  DISTRIBUTION  OF THE CANDY IN THE STATE MAY RESUME.  THE DEPARTMENT
    3  SHALL ALSO NOTIFY THE  PUBLIC  STATING  THAT  SUCH  CANDY  IS  SAFE  FOR
    4  CONSUMPTION.
    5    (C)  IF THE CANDY STILL EXCEEDS THE MAXIMUM ALLOWABLE LEAD LEVEL AFTER
    6  IT HAS BEEN RETESTED, THE MANUFACTURER OR DISTRIBUTOR MAY  TAKE  CORREC-
    7  TIVE  MEASURES  AND  CONTINUE TO RESUBMIT SAMPLES FOR TESTING UNTIL SUCH
    8  CANDY'S LEAD CONTENT IS BELOW THE MAXIMUM ALLOWABLE LEAD  LEVEL  IF  THE
    9  MANUFACTURER  OR  DISTRIBUTOR  WISHES TO SELL OR DISTRIBUTE THE CANDY IN
   10  THE STATE.
   11    5. THE  DEPARTMENT  SHALL  CONDUCT  AN  EXTENSIVE  PUBLIC  INFORMATION
   12  PROGRAM  ON  THE  POTENTIAL  HAZARDS OF CANDY CONTAINING LEAD, TARGETING
   13  CANDY PRODUCTS AND CONSUMERS OF SPECIFIC CANDY PRODUCTS THAT  HAVE  BEEN
   14  FOUND  TO EXCEED THE MAXIMUM ALLOWABLE LEAD LEVEL.  THE DEPARTMENT SHALL
   15  NOTIFY THE PUBLIC THAT SPECIFIC CANDY PRODUCTS THAT EXCEED  THE  MAXIMUM
   16  ALLOWABLE LEAD LEVEL ARE PROHIBITED FROM SALE OR DISTRIBUTION UNTIL THEY
   17  COMPLY  WITH  THE  MAXIMUM  ALLOWABLE  LEAD LEVEL. AT SUCH TIME AS THESE
   18  CANDY PRODUCTS ARE RETESTED AND HAVE BEEN FOUND TO COMPLY WITH THE MAXI-
   19  MUM ALLOWABLE LEAD LEVEL, THE DEPARTMENT SHALL PROVIDE THE  PUBLIC  WITH
   20  SUCH INFORMATION.
   21    6.  ON  OR BEFORE MARCH FIRST EACH YEAR, THE DEPARTMENT SHALL SUBMIT A
   22  REPORT TO THE GOVERNOR AND  THE  LEGISLATURE  WHICH  SHALL  INCLUDE  THE
   23  RESULTS  OF  THE TESTING OF CANDY PURSUANT TO THIS SECTION AND A LISTING
   24  OF ALL CANDIES WHICH ARE PROHIBITED FROM BEING SOLD  OR  DISTRIBUTED  IN
   25  THE STATE PURSUANT TO THIS SECTION.
   26    S  1371-B.  LEAD  IN SOFT VINYL LUNCH BOXES, AND INFANT AND CHILDREN'S
   27  BIBS.  1. THE DEPARTMENT SHALL MONITOR LEAD LEVELS IN AND  ON  ALL  SOFT
   28  VINYL LUNCH BOXES, AND INFANT AND CHILDREN'S BIBS SOLD OR DISTRIBUTED IN
   29  THE STATE. MONITORING SHALL INCLUDE TESTING TO DETERMINE THE LEAD LEVELS
   30  CONTAINED  IN  OR  ON  SOFT VINYL LUNCH BOXES, AND INFANT AND CHILDREN'S
   31  BIBS.
   32    2. NO PERSON OR ENTITY SHALL MANUFACTURE, DISTRIBUTE,  SELL  OR  OFFER
   33  FOR SALE IN THIS STATE ANY SOFT VINYL LUNCH BOX, OR INFANT OR CHILDREN'S
   34  BIB WHICH CONTAINS MORE THAN SIX HUNDRED PARTS PER MILLION OF LEAD. EACH
   35  VIOLATION  OF THIS SUBDIVISION SHALL CONSTITUTE A SEPARATE VIOLATION AND
   36  SHALL SUBJECT THE PERSON COMMITTING THE VIOLATION TO A CIVIL PENALTY  OF
   37  ONE THOUSAND DOLLARS FOR EACH SUCH VIOLATION.
   38    3.  THE  DEPARTMENT  SHALL  CONDUCT  AN  EXTENSIVE  PUBLIC INFORMATION
   39  PROGRAM ON THE POTENTIAL HAZARDS OF SOFT VINYL LUNCH BOXES,  AND  INFANT
   40  AND  CHILDREN'S  BIBS CONTAINING LEAD AND ADVISE ANY PERSON POSSESSING A
   41  SOFT VINYL LUNCH BOX, OR INFANT OR CHILDREN'S BIB ACQUIRED PRIOR TO  THE
   42  EFFECTIVE  DATE  OF THIS SECTION THAT THEY SHOULD DISCARD SUCH LUNCH BOX
   43  OR BIB.  THE DEPARTMENT SHALL UTILIZE ITS WEBSITE  AND  OTHER  MEANS  OF
   44  PUBLIC  OUTREACH TO ENSURE THAT CONSUMERS, PARTICULARLY THOSE WITH CHIL-
   45  DREN, ARE ALERTED TO SUCH HAZARDS. THE  INFORMATION  SHALL  INCLUDE  THE
   46  MEANS  BY  WHICH  THE  PUBLIC  CAN  IDENTIFY SOFT VINYL LUNCH BOXES, AND
   47  INFANT AND CHILDREN'S  BIBS  WHICH  CAN  POTENTIALLY  CONTAIN  EXCESSIVE
   48  LEVELS OF LEAD.
   49    4.  ON  OR BEFORE MARCH FIRST EACH YEAR, THE DEPARTMENT SHALL SUBMIT A
   50  REPORT TO THE GOVERNOR AND THE LEGISLATURE WHICH SHALL INCLUDE A LISTING
   51  OF ALL SOFT VINYL LUNCH BOXES, AND INFANT AND CHILDREN'S BIBS WHICH  ARE
   52  PROHIBITED PURSUANT TO THIS SECTION.
   53    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.
